definitions.text: make a mess of, destroy or ruin
examples: I botched the dinner and we had to eat out
the pianist screwed up the difficult passage in the second movement
The speaker faltered when he saw his opponent enter the room

definitions.text: lacking physical movement skills, especially with the hands; ; ; ; - Mary H. Vorse
examples: could scarcely empty a scuttle of ashes, so handless was the poor creature
